intro: Macaranga cuspidata var. ivohibensis, commonly known as the Madagascar nettle, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its alternate, heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas make it an important species in ecological studies.
